intro: Pseudoeurystyles ochyrana, commonly known as the ochyran orchid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
